item.title: Pelican
item.description: I used Pelican for a simple site/blog, of the newer static website genertors, it is probably the one i favour. It is integrated fairly well for publishing to github pages, while it is python based, no specific python coding skills are required. It uses Markdown (and other languages) to be rendered into HTML.

item.title: Static Website generators
item.description:
I have dabbled in various Static website/blog generators, which seem to be increasing in popularity.
* Pelican
* Nikola
* JBake
* Jekyll
* Hyde

Overall I like Pelican and JBake (by virtue of my java past) many of these are excellent for blogs, and for documentation but aslo for types of website. Static website generators seem to dove tail into many cloud hosting services such as github pages.

item.title: Python - Anaconda
item.description:
I have used some scripting languages in the past, mostly Perl. Python which is quite popular has many advocates. One thing I found Python is especially good at is data crunching. I found Anaconda an excellent tool for python.

  • Python
  • Anaconda
